ccg-setinfo.name: Reflections
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: Aftermath
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. If the total cost of those personnel is 4 or less, they are killed. Otherwise, randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Dignitaries and Witnesses
card.text: Unless you have an Admiral or a General or 3 Leadership, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Eye to Eye
card.text: Your opponent names a number. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has an attribute matching that number is stopped.

card.name: Final Adventure
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Your opponent names a number. For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel who has a cost equal to that number to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Full Security Alert
card.text: Randomly select a Security personnel to be stopped. If that personnel costs 2 or less, randomly select two other Security personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Hard Time
card.text: Place this dilemma in your core. Randomly select a personnel and place him or her on this dilemma. At the start of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and return the personnel on it to his or her owner's hand.

card.name: Helpless
card.text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless he or she has at least one skill listed in this mission requirements, stop that personnel, then randomly select another personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Mr. Tricorder
card.text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. Unless you choose to place him or her aboard your ship at this mission, randomly select two personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Shipboard Fire
card.text: Unless there are no damage markers on this ship, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: The Three Vipers
card.text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Navigation or Astrometrics, Officer, and Science, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, discard a card from hand.

card.name: Unknown Microorganism
card.text: Unless you have Biology, Medical, and Science or 2 Security and a non-Hand Weapon equipment, randomly select a personnel to be killed, all of your other personnel are stopped, and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Urgency
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel may use no more than one skill during each dilemma he or she faces. Each personnel may use no more thatn one skill to meet a mission's requirements. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Worn-Out Welcome
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Anthropology and 2 Diplomacy or Transporters and 3 Treachery, place that personnel on one of your headquarters missions.

card.name: Adapted to Service Us
card.text: To play this event, you must command three [Bor] personnel. Plays in your core. When you win combat or an engagement involving your [Bor] personnel, you may discard the top card of your deck to take command of an opponent's event that has no cards on it. (Move that event to your core.)

card.name: Biogenic Weapon
card.text: To play this event, you must command two [Fed][Maq] personnel. Plays on a mission. This mission cannot be attempted unless its owner has completed each other non-headquarters mission he or she commands.

card.name: Bustling with Activity
card.text: Plays in your core. Each time you play a personnel at Mouth of the Wormhole, each player may discard a card from hand to download a personnel of the same affiliation as the played personnel.

card.name: Changed History
card.text: Temporal. Plays in your core. When you win an engagement involving your [Bor] ship, you may reveal the top card of the loser's deck. If it is a personnel you do not command, you may place him or her on that ship. (You now command that personnel).

card.name: Disadvantage Into Advantage
card.text: To play this event, you must command three [TNG] personnel. Plays in your core. The first unique personnel played each turn costs -2.

card.name: Distant Exploration
card.text: Plays on your headquarters mission. When you complete a mission that has a different quadrant icon than this mission, score 5 points.

card.name: Friction
card.text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core. When a player plays a non-Jem'Hadar personnel, that personnel is stopped.

card.name: Foresight
card.text: Plays in your core. Order - Stop your [Bor] personnel to examine the top card of your deck, then place it on the top or bottom of your deck.

card.name: Guidance of the Council
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play a Diplomacy personnel, you may download a Chancellor or High Council Member.

card.name: High Command 'Motivation'
card.text: Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may kill one of your [Car] personnel to spend a number of additional counters that turn equal to that personnel's cost. If that personnel is unique, you may spend 1 more additional counter that turn.

card.name: Interstellar Treaty
card.text: To play this event, you must command two Diplomacy personnel. Place a Diplomacy personnel from hand who costs 3 or less on your headquarters mission. Destroy this event.

card.name: Invocation of Kosst Amojan
card.text: Pah-wraith. Discard a unique [Baj] personnel from hand to choose one: take two personnel from your discard pile into hand; or download a personnel. Destroy this event.

card.name: Maquis Raid
card.text: To play this event, you must command two [Maq] ships. Plays in your core. When an opponent's personnel gains a skill as an effect of that opponent paying a cost, you may place a card from hand on this event. When your [Maq] personnel is facing a dilemma, you may take a card on this event into hand to make that personnel gain a skill of your choice until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Ohhhh! Nothing Happened!
card.text: Q. Temporal. Plays in your core. When you play another Temporal card, you may destroy this event to name a dilemma. Choose an opponent to take a copy of that dilemma from his or her dilemma pile and remove it from the game. That opponent shuffles and replaces his or her dilemma pile face down.

card.name: Quintessence
card.text: Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may download a [Bor] personnel or ship. When you do this, discard cards from the top of your deck equal to the cost of that card.

card.name: Stalling for Time
card.text: To play this event, you must command three [Fed][Maq] personnel. Name a personnel. Each opponent returns each personnel he or she commands who has that card title to his or her owner's hand. Destroy this event.

card.name: Stealth Mission
card.text: Pursuit. Plays in your core. When your opponent overcomes a dilemma, you may place a card from hand on this event. At the start of each of your turns, take all cards on this event into hand to make your Cloaking Device ship Range +1 until the end of this turn for each card take off this event this way.

card.name: The New Resistance
card.text: To play this event, your opponent must command a ship at a non-headquarters mission. Plays in your core. When you play a Dissident personnel, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a Dissident, you may play him or her at cost -3.

card.name: Tribunal Sentencing
card.text: Punishment. To play this event, you must command three [Car] personnel. Plays in your core. While you have an opponent's personnel in your brig, that opponent has 1 fewer counter to spend during each of his or her Play and Draw Cards segments.

card.name: Change of Heart
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Rom] personnel. When a random selection is made by a dilemma, you may ignore its results and select again.

card.name: Dark Secrets
card.text: Pah-wraith. When your [Baj] personnel is facing a dilemma, remove two cards in your discard pile from the game to make each of your [Baj] personnel attributes +1 until the end of that dilemma (or +3 if you choose an opponent to choose the two cards you remove from the game instead).

card.name: I Need A Little Counseling
card.text: When your personnel is attempting a mission, he or she gains a skill from your [TNG] personnel present until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: No Harm Done
card.text: When a personnel facing a dilemma uses his or her skills, he or she loses all skills until the end of this turn.

card.name: Shri-tal
card.text: When your [Car] personnel is killed by a dilemma, you may draw cards equal to that personnel’s cost.

card.name: Strength for Our Struggle
card.text: When your [Maq] personnel is facing a dilemma, he or she gains one of every skill he or she already has until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Transwarp Conduit
card.text: Order - Move your ship at Destroy Transwarp Hub or Unicomplex to any mission. (No Range is required or used.)

card.name: Odo (Curzon Odo)
card.text: •Anthropology •Diplomacy •2 Law •Security Host. Shape-shifter. This personnel is Cunning+1 for each Diplomacy personnel in your discard pile (limit+4). This personnel is Strength+1 for each Security personnel in your discard pile (limit+4).

card.name: Yarka (Harbringer of the Prophets)
card.text: •Anthropology •Archaeology •Physics While each of your non-headquarters missions is a [Baj] mission, each of your Bajorans present is attributes+1.

card.name: Annexation Drone
card.text: •Geology •Navigation •Physics •Transporters Drone. When you play this personnel, if each of your non-headquarters missions is an [AQ] mission, score 5 points. When you lose command of this personnel, remove it from the game.

card.name: Requisitions Drone
card.text: •Archaeology •Astrometrics •Physics •Science Drone. When you play this personnel, you may examine the top four cards of your deck and take one into hand. Place the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

card.name: Enabran Tain ('Retired' Spymaster)
card.text: •Anthropology •2 Intelligence •Security •2 Treachery When you play this personnel, if each of your non-headquarters missions requires Intelligence, you may draw up to seven cards, then discard two cards from hand.

card.name: Goran
card.text: •Biology •Intelligence •Medical •Transporters Infiltrator. When you play this personnel, you may discard an equipment or event card from hand to make this personnel cost-2.

card.name: Gelnon (Aloof Tactician)
card.text: •Archaeology •Law •Leadership •Science •Treachery When you play this personnel, if each of your non-headquarters missions is an [AQ] mission, you may download a Jem'Hadar and place it aboard your [Dom] ship.

card.name: Ixtana'Rax (Honored Elder)
card.text: •Anthropology •Astrometrics •Honor •Leadership •Navigation •Officer When this personnel uses one of his skills to solve a mission, he is killed.

card.name: Lamat'Ukan (Resourceful Third)
card.text: •Programming •Security •Transporters Alpha. When an engagement you began ends, you may unstop each of your personnel and ships involved and restore all Range those ships have used this turn. You cannot begin any other engagements this turn.

card.name: Jean-Luc Picard (Vintner)
card.text: •Archaeology •Biology •Diplomacy •Science When you play this personnel, if each of your non-headquarters missions requires Biology, you may download up to three [TNG] personnel.

card.name: Kira Nerys (Starfleet Emissary)
card.text: •Leadership •Officer •Security You may play this personnel at Bajor or Cardassia Prime. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to make a non-Bajoran present attributes+2 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Santos (Squad Leader)
card.text: •Leadership •Medical •Navigation •Transporters While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may destroy your event to add that event's cost to this personnel's attributes until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Shankar (Maquis Soldier)
card.text: •Archaeology •Biology •Geology •Officer •Treachery When you play this personnel, if you command at least three Region: Demilitarized Zone missions, you may make each opponent play his or her hand on the top of his or her deck in the order of his or her choice.

card.name: William T. Riker (Wistful Admiral)
card.text: •Leadership •Navigation •Officer •Security Admiral. Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-D. While this personnel is attempting a space mission, he is attributes+1 and gains Diplomacy and Law.

card.name: Alexander Rozhenko (K'mtar)
card.text: •2 Diplomacy •Honor •Programming •Transporters High Council Member. When you play this personnel, if each of your non-headquarters missions requires Diplomacy, you may download up to two events, then play each of them at cost-3.

card.name: Worf (Son of Mogh)
card.text: •2 Honor •Officer •Physics •2 Security When you play this personnel, each opponent draws a card.

card.name: Jean-Luc Picard (Galen)
card.text: •Anthropology •Archaeology •Leadership •Science Commander: Fortune. Thief. While an artifact is in your discard pile, each of your Smuggler personnel and Thief personnel is attributes+1.

card.name: Vina (Orion Slave Girl)
card.text: •Honor Order - This personnel gains any one skill of your choice. She keeps that skill until this order is executed again.

card.name: Deanna Troi (Major Rakal)
card.text: •Anthropology •Telepathy While this personnel is present with a [Rom] Dissident personnel, she is attributes+1 and gains Intelligence, Leadership and Security.

card.name: Mendak (Duplicitous Admiral)
card.text: •Exobiology •Intelligence •Leadership •Officer •Transporters •Treachery Admiral. Commander: Devoras. While each of your non-headquarters missions is not a [Rom] mission, you may attempt each of them using your [Rom] personnel.

card.name: Dominion Battleship
card.text: This ship is attributes +1 for each of these species you have aboard it: Changeling, Jem'Hadar, Vorta.

card.name: U.S.S. Defiant (Repurposed Warship)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you play this ship, if each of your non-headquarters missions is a [GQ] mission, you may spend 5 additional counters this turn.
